general_advisory: Transplanting of vegetables should be done in afternoon hour to avoid high temperature. In case of ear cutting caterpillar incidence in paddy, spray Quinalphos or Chlorpyriphos. After harvesting, Blackgram and Greengram, dry the seeds until the optimum moisture content is attained. At the time of harvesting groundnut pods usually have moisture content around 40-50% and hence need to be dried under direct sunlight to bring moisture content below 10%. Cover the rows with dry leaves in Sugarcane. Apply sprinkler irrigation to bring down the heat effect. High temperature in day hours may lead to wilting in tomato and brinjal. Mulch coconut leaves around a coconut tree to reduce water loss.

advisory: To manage Gundi Bug spray Chlorpyriphos or Malathion.
If infestation of BPH and WBPH occur, spray Neem Based Pesticide or other suggested pesticides.
Groundnut should be stored in polythene lined gunny bags with desiccant like fused Calcium Chloride.
To manage Downy Mildew disease in cucurbits spray Copper Hydroxide or other suggested fungicides.
To manage fruit rot and die back disease in chilli, spray Propineb or other suggested fungicides.
To control mango hoppers, spray Imidacloprid or other suggested insecticides.
During severe heat, provide treatment to animals to avoid reduction in growth rate and milk production.
